p: Furthermore, findings show that the main FAs found in raw and processed chickpea flours is the linoleic acid (about 58%) followed by the oleic acid (23%). Linoleic acid has numerous beneficial impacts, including improved blood lipid profile, improved insulin sensitivity, lower incidence of type 2 diabetes, and anti-arrhythmic effects [ 31]. Oleic acid is known to have beneficial effects on autoimmune and inflammatory diseases, as well as cancer and wound healing [ 32]. In summary, chickpea flours are considered good sources of PUFAs and MUFAs [ 12].
